td.a: Nominations for Teacher of the Year
td.br: The “Teacher of the Year” is awarded annually to a teacher in Valley City Public Schools that demonstrates excellence in education. This tradition began back in 1983 when kindergarten teacher Sharon Stites was awarded the first VCPS “Teacher of the Year”. Thirty-six years later we are continuing on with the proud tradition of recognizing our school districts finest teachers.

img.br: Valley City Public Schools is inviting our community to join the Hi-Liners this Saturday, April 4th for a Drive-In Movie here in Valley City. Following our planning the past two weeks and approval earlier this week from the City of Valley City and City-County Health of Barnes County, we will be sponsoring this free event for all the children and students in Valley City. We will accept Free Will Donations from individuals and businesses that would be supporting this event and other possible future events in our community during the COVID-19 pandemic.

td.a: VCPS Cancels School for the Week of March 23-27, 2020
td.br: We have made the decision this evening to cancel school for the week of March 23rd-March 27th due to the ongoing spread of COVID-19 in the state of North Dakota. Any decisions beyond the week of March 23rd-27th will be made at a later date and shared with our students, staff, parents and guardians.

img.br:
On Thursday, March 19 parents and students of VCPS will have the
opportunity to stop at school to pick up personal belongings and
necessary supplies to continue their educational opportunities at home,
in the event that school closures continue past March 20th. In order to
help alleviate large crowds, we have designated the following times and
divided up families by last name. Please utilize your assigned time slot.
Also, we are envisioning a very quick collection while at school. No
loitering will be encouraged.

Starting Tuesday, March 17th, Valley City Public Schools will provide free meals for children due to the current school closure. Meals will be provided using a drive-through or walk-up meal pick-up process at certain sites in Valley City. Please see attached flyer.

Please see the attached flyer with detailed information regarding the Mental Health Plan that will be initiated in our school district beginning immediately. Our continuation of these services is very important for supporting our students and families through the entirety of this school closure.

td.a: Update on COVID-19 District Plans - 3.16.20 5:30 PM
td.br: Valley City Public Schools has four key areas of our District COVID-19 plan that allows us to continue to meet the needs of our students and families. Below, we have provided a brief summary of this plan. Please know that additional information will be shared by email and social media.

div.p:
Together we are empowering all students to pursue their passion and succeed in a changing world.
#pursueyourpassion
Commitment Statements

ul.li: Building Hi-Liner pride and a positive school culture.
Providing a safe, respectful, and accepting learning environment.
Modeling responsibility, accountability, empathy, and resiliency.
Promoting home, school, and community partnerships.
Developing lifelong learners who can communicate, collaborate, and think creatively and critically.
Graduating choice ready students who will have an opportunity in college, workforce, or the military.
